titles.title: A resolution to prohibit Members of the Senate and other persons from removing art and historic objects from the Senate wing of the Capitol and Senate office buildings for personal use.
A resolution to prohibit Members of the Senate and other persons from removing art and historic objects from the Senate wing of the Capitol and Senate office buildings for personal use.

action.text: Referred to the Committee on Rules and Administration.
Committee on Rules and Administration. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Rules and Administration. Reported by Senator Lott without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 181.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

bill.summary: (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Prohibits Members of the Senate and other persons from removing works of art, historical objects, or exhibits from the Senate wing of the Capitol or any Senate office building for personal use.
